{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

I am thinking of having a field that serves as an time estimator field. That means, that the assignee can specify in days or weeks estimate of period they need to complete an assignment. 

Unfortunately I don't find one in the JIRA custom fields section. 

Any ideas for this? Or is there any alternative to this?
fields.summary: Convert Date Picker to A Time Tracker

When performing a worflow transition on an issue operation it would be great to be able to see previous comments or the previous screen in general

Allowing the addition of entire groups to a watch list would for example allow the sales department to watch in on a particular inquiry to the technical team that might be a lead, allowing them to step in if it turns out that way.  Also, with a distributed corporate structure, it would allow for developmental issues that concern other departments directly to be notified of respective changes that affect them.
fields.summary: Allow for adding entire JIRA groups to a watch list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12901].
  {panel}

A support customer is bringing emails into JIRA using the POP service. An email that contains "inline" XML (i.e. XML as the body of the message, not as an attachment) and with MIME type text/xml, results in an empty JIRA issue being created. That is, the XML is not in the issue, neither as the description nor as an attachment. The XML data is lost.

Furthermore, there is information produced in the log.

The support case is [JSP-12868|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12868].

The customer's email is sent by Microsoft Biztalk. I managed to reproduce the problem, sending the email using Mutt (and super-Jeff). I have attached the mail Jeff and I used to reproduce the problem.

If the email instead has the XML as an attachment (not inline), and the attachment is of type text/xml, then the XML is included in the created issue (as an attachment).

If the XML is in the body of the message, but the message type is text/plain, the XML is included in the created issue (in the description).

That is, the problem only exists for inline XML with mail type text/xml.

Kind regards,
Ian
fields.summary: Email of MIME type text/xml sent to JIRA results in empty issue
Coverage of com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.JiraWebInterfaceManager

Currently we have both French and English people accessing the system. We don't make it mandatory for people to log in as everything is viewable. The problem is obvious here: English users see a French  page when they aren't logged in (French is the default).

It would be nice to offer a link somewhere on the screen to change languages (for the session only).

Even better would be to detect the browser locale and load with that locale if possible (the links to change manually would stay).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Users not logged in should be able to change locale
Ajax Group Picker

Hi,

A main concern from our customer is to have access to a report on the time taken from one status to another ie time taken to handle an issue ( time taken from Open--> Assigned, In Progress --> Resolved)

At the moment, you have to go into each single issue to have the information and it is impossible to collate all this.

Is there any plan to implement such reporting tool?

Rgds

Mel

it is reset to the default value 20.

The setting of "User per Page" of the User Browser of the Administration remember my setting though.

Please fix this for the User Picker.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12811].
  {panel}

The 'Contact Administrators' screen is useful, but lists all administrators 'equally'.

In our organisation I am the primary administrator; and a couple of others also have admin rights for when I'm not available, or because they are trusted to do their own admin stuff for the projects they administer. Unfortunately they appear first in the list of administrators in the 'Contact Administrators' screen, and we have had a couple of incidents of users sending problem reports and requests to them; and these requests getting lost or delayed as a result.

It would be useful for us if we could either set a 'Primary' administrator contact; and have that displayed prominently in the 'Contact Administrators' screen; or even to be able to set the text for that screen so that a custom (html?) message can be displayed giving a preferred contact method/user. 
Being able to suppress the 'full' list of administrators would be useful, but is not a priority for us. However, companies with a publicly visible Jira server might want to hide this list to 'channel' all support requests via a single point of contact (eg. a mail list).
fields.summary: Add ability to customise 'Contact Administrators' screen
Filters should allow filtering by project role
Display issue description and comments when performing a workflow action

Our users would like to have possibilty to choose when they want to send email.

Like when you add comment, they want to choose to sending email like "Send email to... [X]" or not to send ""Send email to... [ ]"

-JP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12773].
  {panel}

Hello JIRA team,

I want to have a custom field required without a  "none" option on the resolve screen.  
These are the requirements of a custom field and all of them should be maintained at the same time :(
1) The custom field to be required
2) The custom field not to have a "none" option
3) The custom field to be on the resolve screen
4) The custom field to not effect submit screen or other screens which does not have this custom field

If I make the custom field "required",  then the submit screen does not allow me to make a transition without filling this required custom field although it belongs to the resolve screen.
So, I downloaded the extension "Workflow Validator to require a field on a transition screen" and make the custom field "optional".  The problem of transition is fixed but  a  "none" option appears for this field value on the resolve screen.

Please help me

Thanks and Best regards,

Lerzan Sencer
fields.summary: Provide a custom field required  without a  "none" option on the resolve screen
Option to show resolved issues for popular issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12736].
  {panel}

The User Browser administration interface is nice and simple, but when you have 370 users it is sometimes hard to find people.

Suggestion 1:

Allow sorting on the headlines, e.g. sort on Full Name or email

Suggestion 2:

Search on more fields than just email, such as full name and user name

Suggestion 3:

Instead of splitting the result into pages 1, 2, 3, 4 split by characters in the alphabet, e.g. A B C D E. You don't need to go fancy and do A-F, G-I etc, it would be enough just to choose the first letter.

PS The Jira user admin interface is a LOT better than the Confluence admin interface, it's very confusing with the required wildcard characters. Well done Jira!

PPS I guess the "Users Per Page: All" option was designed to avoid the above suggestions
fields.summary: Allow to sort the user list on User Browser on different user attributes
Make watch list sortable
Make Issue Links column sortable in Issue Navigator

Increasingly, within our organisation, Jira is being used by non-IT departments. These departments would like to use the "Component" and "Versions" functionality, but would like the ability to customise the text to fit their specific domains.

I propose that the text labels for these be configured on a per project basis.

Cheers

Michael
fields.summary: Allow per-project customisation of the "Components" and "Versions" text.
Every JIRA user should see his assigned project roles in his profile view

Would be nice if it was possible if an IssueEventListener had a method that is called back when issue's watcher have been added/removed.
This can be a single event  like WatchersModified containing the issue.

We need this functionality to implement an extension that would populate issue's watchers into sub-tasks' watchers - seems doesn't supported by Jira itself.
If there is another way of doing it, then probably the event may not be needed.

Perhaps it could be an update of Jeff's [JIRA as a support system|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+as+a+support+system] page.

Cheers,

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. For the specific use case described below (users creating support tickets) we recommend [JIRA Service Desk|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk], which is built for internal support on JIRA. For other types of customization, please check out the add-ons mentioned in the comments ([Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui] and [Email This Issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue]).

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently, under User Default Settings, Jira allows you to decide whether users should be notified of their own changes.  We've found that it is absolutely necessary to have that setting set to "NO" -- that is, users should NOT be notified of their own changes.  Otherwise, entirely too many notifications are sent out.  This creates an issue, however.  Our users are accustomed to receiving an acknowledgment that their support emails have been received.  We cannot figure out a way to have such an email sent out from Jira while the "Notify users of their own changes?" setting is set to "NO".
fields.summary: There needs to be some way to send out an email acknowledgment for issues created via email handler
CreateOrComment handler should accept emails without a subject or reply with a failure notice
Deleting an issue should not delete the changelog history associated with it
Assign an issue to a specific version AND all above.
Status In Progress should be reset when Issue is re-assigned.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12615].
  {panel}

When using the JIRA windows installer and clicking "Install JIRA as a service", the windows service is created under the name "Atlassian JIRA Enterprise Edition 3.8.1". 

This is very impractical, because

- the service name is very long
- it has spaces, which breaks shell scripts (at least makes it more difficult to write them)
- it has a release number in the name which is certainly bad practice
-  you can't execute "net stop JIRA" anymore
- the existing Atlassian documentation is using JIRA as the service name.

Please make it a short name without spaces, such as "JIRA". Should be also trivial to fix.
fields.summary: Windows service name is too long and impractical
Include formating styles for Excel view
Better usability for multi-issue editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12604].
  {panel}

When a customer reports a bug in our software - we need to record the details of the customer as well as the issue details. For example, we need to know the Business Name, the Manager's name, the Franchisee's name, The phone number, and the fax number of the business reporting the problem. Obviously we don't want to make these Issue fields because we don't want to record the same information each time that business reports a bug!

We can add user properties to track the information - great. But the feature is actually quite useless because you can't make these fields available in the Issue screens!

How does any user of Jira track these properties of the users? Surely this lack of functionality is a glaring shortcoming of the whole system?

Please refer to my live chat session with one of your technicians below earlier....

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
You are now chatting with Yuen Chi
Leigh Morum: Hi and thanks for taking my call 

Yuen Chi: Hi Leigh, how may I help you? 
Leigh Morum: We are evaluating Jira as we would like to use it to track issues. The problem we have is that after adding user properties - e.g. Company Name, Phone Number, Manager's name etc - we would like to make these new fields available to the help desk technicians. 

Leigh Morum: I can't find a way of adding these fields to the default screen to either display them to the technician - or to allow editing of the fields by the technician. 

Yuen Chi: User properties? May I know what's the JIRA version you are using? 
Leigh Morum: It's 3.8.something 

Leigh Morum: The latest one I just downloaded a week ago. 

Yuen Chi: Cool. 
Yuen Chi: I'm sorry to tell you that, currently the user properties feature is reserved for admin use. 
Yuen Chi: However, what I can suggest is, 
Yuen Chi: You can write custom field to extract these values, then add them to the resolve issue screen. 
Yuen Chi: May I know if you have any Java / JIRA API programmers at your side? 
Leigh Morum: OK that sounds promising! But I have no idea how to implement. I don't have any Java programmers this side so we're a bit wet behind the hears with this. 

Yuen Chi: If that's the case, we can get one of our service partners to get in touch with you regarding this issue. 
Leigh Morum: please 

Yuen Chi: If you have some techies at your side, you can get them to look at these pages:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Plugin+Guide
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Custom+Field+Plugin+Module 
Leigh Morum: Can someone call me? 

Leigh Morum: +27824530754 

Leigh Morum: or Skype username lmorum 

Yuen Chi: Can I get them to get back to you on Monday? 
Leigh Morum: Sure no problem. 

Leigh Morum: Thanks for your help 

Yuen Chi: Is lmorum@cosoft.co.za the point of contact? 
Leigh Morum: yes that e-mail is perfect 

Yuen Chi: Do you mind to give me your company name? So that I can refer this back to my manager. 
Leigh Morum: Sure - it's Coherent Software Solutions (Pty) Ltd trading as Cosoft 

Yuen Chi: Cool, thanks  
Leigh Morum: ok thanks & cheers 

Yuen Chi: Is there anything else that you'd like information on? 
Leigh Morum: One last thing 

Leigh Morum: Can I add a custom user field called Phone Number for example - to then be an available field for each user? i.e. without having to add the custom field to each and every user. 

Yuen Chi: Based on my technical understanding, yes, this is do-able. 
Leigh Morum: Currently you have to go to each user and type in Custom field "Telephone" then the value. I want the new field "Telephone" to then e available for all users. 

Yuen Chi: Oh I'm sorry, do you mean you want to apply the value through JIRA web interface on all users? 
Leigh Morum: You know how you currently go into edit a user - you just get the email address and the username. I want to get those two as well as the new "Telephone" field. i.e. Without having to add "Telephone" as a field property for each user record. 

Leigh Morum: You shouldn't have to type the word "Telephone" a thousand times if I have a thousand customer user 
s!
Leigh Morum: You should be able to create a custom field called "Telephone" and then it's available as a property for all users - not just the one. 

Yuen Chi: That's currently not possible in JIRA without customizing it. 
Leigh Morum: So it's really just a user property for a single user record? 

Yuen Chi: 
Yuen Chi: For time being and by default, yes. 
Leigh Morum: That's a great pity! The whole system looks perfect for our business - but we need to know more than just a username and password when tracking reported bugs or anything else. I would imagine other companies would be in a similar situation. 

Leigh Morum: Is there a way of getting around this issue? 

Yuen Chi: Actually, our developers would like to hear from our customers about how this should be used.
fields.summary: We need to access user properties from issue screens!
Is there a way to restrict users from commenting on closed issues?
Apply Bulk Change to Original Estimate ( Time Tracking ) field
Link to support site in JIRA footer
"BACK TO TOP" button at the bottom of issue pages, particularly for pages with numerous comments
document the Scheduler
document the Mail Queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12578].
  {panel}

I find the sub-tasks very useful in terms of organizing work and monitoring progress. However, it is difficult to organize the sub-tasks. There are two views: All and Open. To change the order of the sub-tasks in the list, I would have to move each one up or down, one position at a time. It becomes quite a chore when there are 20 or more sub-tasks. 

It would be very useful to have some ways to sort them: 
- by sub-task names 
- by assignee 
- by status
- by priority
fields.summary: Add sorting for sub-tasks
Ability for user to see own project roles
Versions needs start/end fields or should allow custom fields
Option to select more than one comment/work log/change history tab at once
Some deleted comments should not be viewable

fields.description:
Hello JIRA team,

I was just going through the examples of JIRA development and got stuck on the CloseParentIssue workflow function. I compiled the example and deployed it to our test server. The function itself works fine and closes the parent issue after executing (detail view of the issue is updated). When I had a look at the transitions of the issue, I saw that the transition is not available in the history list (transitions) of the issue and in the navigator, it still shows the status the issue had before executing the post function!!

After having a look at the sourcecode I recognized that the variable 'store' (type WorkflowStore) is never used! Maybe the example is not complete at all?!? 

BTW, after re-indexing the database (Administration -> Indexing), the navigator shows the correct status! 

Thanks in advance!

Regards,
Christian
fields.summary: Example CloseParentIssueFunction
Option to Print Last <n> Comments on Full Content
Make "Sub-task Progress" available as a column in Navigator and Filter Gadgets
Include jutf7 jar in JIRA distribution
NOTIFICATIONS - need to notification schemes at the issue type level
Allow collapsing of versions in roadmap
Plugin Guide for Issue Views

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12514].
  {panel}

I want to notify some users (watchers, for example) about all comments, but not about all events.

If watchers are subscribers only to "Issue Commented" event, then watchers won't be notified about comment made when issue is reassigned with comment, for example.

If watchers are subscribed to all events where comments are possible, then watchers will be notified about all events even without comment, for example about all field value changes.

It would be great if users subcribed to "Issue Commented", received notifications about all events with non-empty comments.

Don't know how to easily hack that. Voted +1 for JRA-8743.
fields.summary: User should be notified about all events with non-empty comments when user is subscribed to "Issue commented" event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12512].
  {panel}

We are using several tabs in our issue screens to organize issue fields.

Our users (talented and experienced engineers) are having difficulties to quickly identify that such links are providing access to additional fields that need to be filled during the workflow steps.
Either they can't find the information they are looking for, or this is slowing down issue creation as that's after mandatory checkings that they have to filled to missing fields in other tabs.

I have highlighted in the attached screenshot an example of the concerned area.

The request is to:
. Improve the default look&feel of these tabs so that they better look like tabs, especially for the issue fields, instead of regular links
. Offer the ability to customize the colors of such tabs (like done for other parts of the GUI), to let customers do some minimum color customization, in a standard way.

I noticed that no explicit CSS style was used on that part of the interface. Using appropriate CSS tags would be a first step to help customization.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Look&Feel Improvement & Customization for Screen tabs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12506].
  {panel}

IllegalArgumentException: There are no Labels custom fields in this project

This exception is being thrown from [JIRA Labels plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Labels+Plugin?showComments=false]. The stack-trace of this exception is
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: There are no Labels custom fields in this project.
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.labels.utils.LabelUtils.getLabelsCustomFieldId(LabelUtils.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.labels.heatmap.LabelsHeatmapProjectTabPanel.getHtml(LabelsHeatmapProjectTabPanel.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.Browser.getProjectTabHtml(Browser.java:338)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor640.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:426)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:175)
	at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:61)
	at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54)
	at _jsp._includes._panels._browser._tabpanels__jsp._jspService(_tabpanels__jsp.java:382)
	at com.caucho.jsp.JavaPage.service(JavaPage.java:60)

fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException: There are no Labels custom fields in this project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12505].
  {panel}

Hello,

When an issue is moved to a project to which the Reporter (or watcher) does not have permissions, the move notification is not delivered to him. I can understand that a person is not notified on the projects to which he doesn't have permissions, but he should at least be notified of the move - otherwise he doesn't even have a clue to what happened.
Can something be done about that?

Kind Regards,
Aleksey
fields.summary: Notification not sent when issue moved to a project to which the user has no permissions
Limited Browse Users permisson
Linking Priority to Due date
Automatically create links for issues that have moved project
The local help should be specific to a project
OrderableField.getViewHTML on renderable customfields does not use passed issues value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12478].
  {panel}

I'd like to see some improvements on how email notifications are sent. There are a few problems with it at the moment:

- As a non-admin, I can only configure a limited amount of email notifications myself, i.e. watches and scheduled filter reports. If I want to watch for all activity on a project (for example) I can't - the server admin has to.

- Event based email notifications should ideally be more fine grained. As an example, say some users want to know about all new issues of a certain component as soon as they are created, but not the whole project. As far as I can tell, that's not possible right now - you either get notified of all new issues for a project or none at all.

Basically, I think the ideal case is that users should be able to set up email events based on filters, i.e. like the scheduled email, but whenever there's a change, rather than after a schedule. And when this email is sent, it's the update, not the entire filter list.

I'd be keen to see this go in so please feel free to throw ideas at me!
fields.summary: Email sending improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12468].
  {panel}

Create a new search
Enter 2 keys into the Multi Issue Key Searcher (as shown in Screen shot)
click View
This returns the 2 issues
Click Permlink -- the permlink will not contain a reference to the keys. 

This is an example of the permlink generated.

https://jira.polycom.com:8443/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC 

Normally, a permlink will contain the search criteria so that the search can be re-executed.

https://jira.polycom.com:8443/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&reporterSelect=issue_current_user&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC
fields.summary: Permlink for Multi Issue Key Searcher field should contain values of issue keys

GLOSSARY TERMS:

(please feel free to add to this list)

Condition
Dashboard
Filter
Gadget
Global Permission
Issue

Issue security level (Issue permission)
Permission
Priority
Project

Project Role
Resolution
Role
Scheme
Screen scheme
Status
Step
Sub-task
Transition
Workflow


(NB. remember to wrap the actual definition inside the {excerpt} macro, so that additional info can be added that won't be displayed via the {include}/{excerpt-include} macro)

Add ability to search by Comments recently changed or added within a certain timeframe
Single Group by Report should be able to display formatted comments created within a certain timeframe
Single Group by Report only works for Saved Filters - It would be nice to make a report from the Issue Navigator cache

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12439].
  {panel}

We use the lastest version of Jira. We currently use one project as our development project and others to support the cycle of issue management and suggestions. I need to be able to assign project lead and project team members as roles to each 'version' as in essence the versions are sub-projects. I can't find anything immediately logged for this. 

# Can you advise what I could do? 
# Or could this functionality be added? 

Thanks. Annastashia
fields.summary: Ability to assign project lead and project team members to versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12400].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

JIRA-1100 introduced editable comments.  This is great.  When our security officer reviewed the feature he wanted access to the change history, which would be important in the event of a security audit.  It appears that there is no way to view comment history.  I'm opening this improvement request to ask for the ability to view comment change history.  Ideally, this would be implemented such that a new permission was added 'View comment change history' so that its implementation could be configured at the site level.
fields.summary: Need ability to see change history of edited comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12397].
  {panel}

The subscription to a filter is a great feature. A possible improvement could be to send the email notification ONLY if the filter content has changed. A kind of "diff". It will avoid spam, and be more efficient for recipient.
I don't know how to do this today, so I guess it should be classified as an improvement request, ... if that feature is already available, please let me know how can I use it !

thanks in advance. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Filter Subscription - Notify only when changes appeared
Improve the JIRA Backup/Restore feature
Prevent unassigned issues from being closed
Don't show comments in Full Content view
Allow filtering by excluded assignee

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12362].
  {panel}

I recently opened a support request because my 'Assignee' email notifications were not being generated, even though 'Current Assignee' was a recipient of all 'Issue Assigned'.

I was setting the assignee of issues three ways:
1. Using the 'Assign to' link
2. Setting the assignee while editing an issue, using 'Edit'
3. Setting the assignee during a transition

Because the current assignee was not a recipient of 'Issue Updated' and 'Work Started on Issue' events, no email notifications were sent. 

I am requesting that all relevant events be triggered each time the event occurs. For example if an assignee and fix version is set while editing an issue, this should trigger both Issue Updated & Issue Assigned. If an assignee & fix version is set while transitioning to In Progress, this should trigger 'Work Started on Issue', 'Issue Updated', and 'Issue Assigned'.

All relevant events should be triggered, and the recipient should receive a single notification. In our particular application, we want the current assignee to receive a notification each time they are assigned, but only the watchers to receive notification when an issue is updated. Sending the current assignee emails every time an issue is updated by anybody (they are able to disable notifications for their own changes) is far too many notifications for our needs. Unfortunately, including Current assignee to the Issue Updated list is the only way to get them to receive AT LEAST the assignee emails.
fields.summary: Fire all notification scheme events regardless of whether or not other events have been activated
Assign issue could have text entry field as option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12355].
  {panel}

So I'm fairly new to JIRA, but I search around to see if this is already logged, and it seems not.

I'd like to use the watcher list just like the cc list in Bugzilla.  All users can see who is watching, and can add others to the watch list.  the one thing you don't want is for someone to get removed from the watch list without their knowledge.

One way to do this is to not enable anyone but the user themselves to remove themselves, which would work if JRA-7739 was implemented.

But as the product stands now, correct operation should ensure that someone who is removed be notified of the change; they can always add themselves back if they wish.
fields.summary: A Watching user is not notified when they are removed from the Watcher list
Ability to hide comment visibility
Add Update User functionality
Associate transitions with operations
Installer should check to see if another un/installer is running
Expose the filter sharing data in RemoteFilter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12319].
  {panel}

Hi,

we are creating an workflow and we need to create this property to exclude all of the resolutions except the one we want. Image if I create one more resolution, it will appears on the resolution combo. Is there a way we could exclude all except one, like this:

jira.field.resolution.exclude

value: 1,2,3,5,6,*

PS: this will  exclude all the resolutions except the number 4.

 
Kind Regards...
 
Renato Isidio
fields.summary: jira.field.resolution.exclude - Exclude all the resolutions except one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-12312].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap; however, there are a number of third-party plugins mentioned in [this post from Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/47652/jql-jira-filter-on-worklog] that can accomplish this.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

I am looking for a way to search for all tasks that a specific user has been involved with.  

For example:
Tom creates a jira task and assigns it to Sally.
Sally logs work against the task and runs into a road block that only Jim can solve.
Sally assigns the task to Jim.
Jim logs work on the task and assigns it back to Sally.
Sally logs work and resolves the task.
Tom reviews and closes the task.

The task now shows Tom as the reporter and the Assignee.  There is no way to know that Sally and Jim worked on the task.  

It would be nice to have a search option to find out that  Sally (or Jim) contributed to the task.

This relates somewhat to JRA-6137
fields.summary: Search by work log user entries
Make JIRA search accessible via OpenSearch
Edit comment - suppress e-mail notifications
